title.$t: Issues - chromium
Crash in [TabController inRapidClosureMode]

content.$t:
Copying a stack trace from Issue 22538, because I think this bug has a separate root cause.

#0  0x953bd688 in objc_msgSend ()
#1  0x05bfffba in -[TabController inRapidClosureMode] (self=0x21ccf40,
_cmd=0x724f650) at
/Users/vtl/dev/google/cr-git2/src/chrome/browser/cocoa/tab_controller.mm:243
#2  0x05c07aee in -[TabView mouseDown:] (self=0x189ca0, _cmd=0x953f2918,
theEvent=0x21cb210) at
/Users/vtl/dev/google/cr-git2/src/chrome/browser/cocoa/tab_view.mm:254
#3  0x94095af7 in -[NSWindow sendEvent:] ()
#4  0x940626a5 in -[NSApplication sendEvent:] ()
#5  0x93fbffe7 in -[NSApplication run] ()


Reproduce with:
1) Open a window with two tabs in it.
2) Drag one tab out into its own window
3) Grab that same tab and drag it around.  While dragging, right-click.

BOOM!

The second drag operation does something to delete the Browser object and create a new one.  
As part of this process, we destroy the TabStripController, but TabController still hangs on to a 
pointer.  Not sure why things aren't getting reparented correctly.

title.$t: download shelf doesn't seem to use the theme right

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. go to https://tools.google.com/chrome/intl/en/themes/theme_desktop.html 2. apply the theme What is the expected output? What do you see instead? look at the download shelf, it appears the image shouldn't be tiled since there seems to be right edge to the image that looks odd when tiled across.

title.$t: tab bar doesn't seem to be applying themes right

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. go to https://tools.google.com/chrome/intl/en/themes/theme_zenspring.html 2.apply the theme What is the expected output? What do you see instead? the preview shows a tree branch in the top behind the tabs, i only see a solid shade of green.

title.$t: origin not set on tab tile for themes

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. go to https://tools.google.com/chrome/intl/en/themes/theme_verticalstripe.html 2. apply the them 3. start resizing the window tall/short and what the tabs What is the expected output? What do you see instead? we must not be dealing with the origin right for the tile in the tabs, as you resize, you'll see the pattern move up/down the yellow vs. purple through the image makes it really easy to see.

title.$t: Report a bug or broken website in the Help menu of the Menubar doesn't work

content.$t:
"Report a bug or broken website" is in the page menu, but should also be in 
the menubar some place.

I believe it gets context from the active view, so I'm not sure if it make sense 
to go directly in the help menu or not.

Cole/Ben - Where should this go in the Menubar?

title.$t: help menu item is disabled if there are no browser windows opened

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. close all windows 2. open the help menu What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Google Chrome/Chromium Help is disabled.

title.$t: Open File ( Command+ O )  opens multiple new windows

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: Macintosh-0017f2d64524.local Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L27) Processor: 2 Intel 2.33 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 4.0.221.0 <<<Release>>> QuickTime Player: 7.6.4 QuickTime PlayerX: <unknown> Flash Player: 10.0.32 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. title.$t: Find -results of previous window are lost using find in another window.

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: testing-102.local Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L30) Processor: 2 Intel 2.40 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 4.0.221.6 <<<Release/Debug>>> QuickTime Player: 7.6.4 QuickTime PlayerX: <unknown> Flash Player: 10.0.32.18 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open 2 windows parallel not over lapping each other ( as in attached screen shot) 2. In both the window open find. ( Cmd + f) 3. In one window in the find box type some text. Observe the second window when typing text in first window. What is the expected output? If we change find text in one window, the find text in other window is lost. should not be like that, Should work similar to windows. What do you see instead? If we change find text in one window, the find text in other window is lost.

title.$t: Switching from rich text to plain text in gmail infinite-loops

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.221.8 URLs (if applicable) : http://gmail.com/ OS version : 10.5.8 Behavior in Safari 4.0.3 (5531.9): Switches from rich text to plain text. Behavior in Firefox 3.5.3: Switches from rich text to plain text. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to a gmail email 2. Click reply 3. Switch to and from rich text. 4. When the rich-text->plain-text button brings up a dialog, click yes. 5. Watch Chrome use one CPU completely and not switch to plain text. 6. Go to another google URL in that tab. 7. Watch it hang forever "Waiting for mail.google.com..." 8. Go to a non-google URL in that tab 9. Watch it get there successfully, and your CPU use go back down to normal. What is the expected result? Switches to plain text without using up a CPU. What happens instead? See steps.

title.$t: Bookmark bar layout corrupted by hiding then showing

content.$t:
- launch chromium, let it stay on new tab page with bookmark bar present. 
Make sure you have items on your bookmark bar.
- hide bookmark bar, see it blend into NTP page contents.
- show bookmark bar

expected:
- bookmark bar should look correct

actual:
- bar contents overlap the omnibox and back/forward buttons

Resizing the window doesn't help.

title.$t: Esc after opening the bookmark bubble should remove bookmark

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.221.0 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Accidentally hit cmd-d 2. Curse, hit esc What is the expected result? Bookmark should be removed again, like on linux and probably windows. What happens instead? Page stays bookmarked

title.$t: Close/Minimize/Zoom too low in popup windows

content.$t:
- open a popup window (pop out gmail chat, unblock a popup, etc)

expected:
- title bar looks like other apps

actual:
- traffic light is too low, almost at the bottom of the title bar.

We should only be adjusting the positioning for main windows, not popup 
windows. I'll leave the referendum on the fact that we're moving them at all 
out of this bug.

-> dmac who I think was the one tinkering with this.

content.$t:
- open any window, but it's much more visible in incognito

expected:
- rounded corners

actual:
- square corners with the background painting rounded corners over a white 
background, leaving some of the white exposed and visible.

Visual regression -> dmac

title.$t: Bubble (status bubble, pop-up blocker) background is blue instead of gray with default theme

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Use the default theme. 2. Hover over some links, or get some pop-ups blocked. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expect: the status bubble or pop-up blocker bubble should have a gray background. It does in 4.0.221.8 (221 branch r28160; the 221 branch was cut from trunk r28091). Observe: a blue background. This looks suspiciously like the same blue used for this purpose on Windows with the default theme. I am seeing this in trunk r28672. This is a new regression. I suspect that it occurred with the update from GTM r226 to r230, at our trunk r28613. The attached image shows a status bubble from 4.0.221.8 on top (gray, the original behavior) and r28672 on bottom (blue, regression). From -[BubbleView drawRect:] (chrome/browser/cocoa/bubble_view.mm:92): // workaround for default theme // TODO(alcor) next GTM update return nil for background color if not set; if ([color isEqual:[NSColor colorWithCalibratedWhite:0.5 alpha:1.0]]) color = nil; if (!color) color = [NSColor colorWithCalibratedWhite:0.9 alpha:1.0]; [color set]; [border fill]; When we reach this code at r28672, neither condition evaluates to true. In the past, I believe we were setting color to [NSColor colorWithCalibratedWhite:0.9 alpha:1.0]. I have no clue what Cole's comment actually means.

title.$t: cmd-` doesn't work when web contents has focus

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open two chrome windows, give focus to contents 2. Hit cmd-` What is the expected result? Windows should cycle What happens instead? Nothing. This is a regression caused by me sending keyboard events to the renderer first. When they come back, I only send them to the main menu, and we don't have a "Cycle windows" menu entry bound to cmd-`. Finder does e.g. have this. I think the best fix is to just add this menu entry? Are there other keyboard shortcuts that should Just Work but are not in a menu item?

title.$t: Command-W beeps at me instead of closing my tabs

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Have some tabs 2. Want to have fewer tabs 3. Command-W What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I expect a tab to close when I press command-W. Instead, I get beeped at. Sometimes, when I press command-T and then quickly press command-W while the new tab is springing, I get beeped at. If I open a whole bunch of tabs and then hold down command-W, I'll get beeped at for sure. This may be because of the gymnastics that we go through to switch command-W between close-tab and close-window, but I see this when I have a boatload of tabs open, so nothing should be changing the command-W binding. This may also be because of something new we're doing with offering these commands to the renderer. I don't think that this used to suck as badly as it does now, so maybe there's something to the renderer theory. Please use labels and text to provide additional information. Trunk r29077

title.$t: Write design doc for fullscreen behavior

content.$t:
Our fullscreen behavior is sometimes weird, sometimes inconsistent.  We should write up a design 
doc detailing exactly what functionality we want to support.  Things to consider:

- Can we open new tabs? close tabs? switch tabs?
- We grey out a number of menu commands, but their keyboard shortcuts sometimes still work.
- What if we get a javascript alert that originates in a background (non-fullscreen) window?
- How should http auth sheets work?  Can we switch between fullscreen/nonfullscreen while they 
are open?

Look to windows for inspiration.

title.$t: No more symbolic links in the .app (en.lproj -> en_US.lproj)

content.$t:
I thought we had filed a bug about this, but I can't find it.

We need to kill the en.lproj -> en_US.lproj symbolic link in our package.  
Ideally we'd do something special and output en.lproj instead of 
en_US.lproj.

Symbolic links aren't included in the code signature.  Having en.lproj be a 
symbolic link makes it possible to replace all theme.pak resources for 
English users that haven't selected a more specific locale without altering 
the application's fingerprint.  Doing so is as simple as retargeting the 
symbolic link to point elsewhere.  This is a security problem to some 
extent.

I've removed all other symbolic links from our .app package.  en.lproj is 
the only one that remains (although it's present in three places).

title.$t: Make sure icons are not scaled up in the Extension installation dialog

content.$t:
The code on Windows that sets up the icon in the Extension install dialog 
(see constructor of InstallDialogContent in extension_install_prompt.cc) now 
only scales images down if they are too large (above 85x85).

I'm not sure the Mac version of this file 
(browser/cocoa/extension_install_prompt.mm) does this as well (I glanced at 
the code and didn't see any scaling), but we need to investigate it and make 
sure it doesn't scale images up to 85x85.

A good test case is installing an extension with no icon from a .crx, in 
which case you'll get the default extension icon (puzzle piece), which is 
67x67. It should display as 67x67.

title.$t: CRASH dragging link versus JavaScript close

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Arrange to view the attached test.html. 2. W/in 5 seconds, drag the link it shows and do not drop it. 3. After the tab closes, drop it. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Crashes the browser.

title.$t: CRASH tab content drop target versus JavaScript close

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Arrange to be viewing the attached test.html. 2. W/in 5 seconds, select-all in omnibox, then click-drag the text. 3. Keep the drag over the content view until close. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Crashes the browser. Another repro is to open test.html, and drag a file from the Finder and hold it over the content area until close. Or drag an URL from Safari.

title.$t: CRASH back/forward history versus JavaScript close

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Browse to www.google.com. 2. Browse to attached test.html. 3. w/in 5 seconds, click and hold on the back button. 4. After close, select something. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Crash. Can also repro using forward button, just takes more work.

title.$t: CRASH Infobar close button versus JavaScript close

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Make the attached test.html your home page. 2. Provoke a crash. 3. Restart Chrome. 4. w/in 5 seconds, make the window key, and press and hold the infobar close button. 5. Release after window closes. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Crashes the browser. Let me know if I can provoke an info bar more easily. You can make a crash by browsing to test.html, and click-dragging the link and holding it over the content until it crashes.

title.$t: Need a utility to get OS Version for Mac and Linux

content.$t:
In BugReportUtil, we need to send the version of the OS being used as 
information for the bug report.  We have a facility for getting the OS 
version on Windows, but none for Mac or Linux.

content.$t: Need to add the attached pressed and hover states for the new tab button on the Mac.

title.$t: Ts regression

content.$t:
We regressed from the high 290ms to mid 300ms in the range 30847-30854 is.
Suspected is 30849, which fixed issue 26457 by loading a folder icon from
the system rather than the resource bundle.

title.$t: Folder view in bookmark editor dialog is wacky

content.$t:
In the bookmark editor view we seem to be using a column view for folders. I 
understand Finder sometimes presents files/folders in this view but I think 
it's a bad use of space for this context.

We should use a tree view of folders instead.

We're not paying enough attention to sync on mac to get it to Beta quality (full 
eng and test focus).

We should disable sync for Mac on the Beta branch before we release.

We are not suspending renderer resizes when animating the infobars, and I think this is leading to 
lowish framerates.  Fix.

title.$t: Download item text not readable for some themes

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.237.0 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install a theme where the bookmark text color is the same as the toolbar button background color. The only theme I know where that is the case is https://tools.google.com/chrome/intl/en/themes/theme_at_karimrashid.h tml 2. Download something What is the expected result? Primary text on download item should be readable. What happens instead? It's not. The reason for this is that we paint download items like buttons, while windows/linux paint download items with a transparent white rounded rect. If triage thinks this is M4 material, I can probably get this in until friday. Let me know.

title.$t: report a bug dialog doesn't send consistent values for problem_type

content.$t:
looks like we use the index of the menu for the problem type, if the window 
was opened without a browser window, the indexes are different.  the values 
should be normalized to always match on all platforms otherwise, looking at 
the data is sorta challenging.

NOTE: you'll have to make an enum that matches windows for now because 
the values windows uses are in a file we can't share.  I filed http://crbug.com/27281 for that problem.

title.$t: Browser crash: DownloadAnimationTabObserver::Observe()

content.$t:
This animation crash has been showing up on chromebot for a while now. I thought it was filed already but cannot find it now. Please dupe if you can find.
I can reliably repro this on a machine with the following simplified command (build the 'reliability_test' target first):
./reliability_tests --list=f --nopagedown --continuousload --extra-chrome-flags='--enable-crash-reporter'

(where f is the attached file containing 2 urls)

The crash happens when you download stuff from a url, then very quickly navigate to another url while the animation is still in progress. The above command lets you do just that.

title.$t: [Snow Leopard only]  Bookmark bubble drawing issue.

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: macintosh-00145168447a-2.local Mac OS X Version 10.6.2 (Build 10C540) Processor: 1 Intel 1.50 GHz RAM: 1024 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 4.0.245.0 r31763 <<<Release/Debug>>> QuickTime Player: 7.6.4 QuickTime PlayerX: 90.3.1 Flash Player: 10.0.32 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open 2 windows one beside another( attached screen shot image1) 2. Click for bookmark bubble in window one. 3. When the bubble is still open in window one click for bookmark bubble in window two. 4. Observe the book mark bubble in window one. What is the expected output? Should draw bookmark bubble below the star. What do you see instead? On first click bookmark bubble is not displayed in the window two. In window one the bubble is move down from its expected position. ( Attached screen shot 2) Note : This is only on Snow Leopard , It works fine on Leopard.

title.$t: Buggy voicemail playback in Google Voice

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.246.0 (31887) URLs (if applicable) : www.google.com/voice OS version : 10.6.2 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): Normal Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): Normal Behavior in Chrome for Windows: ? What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to any voicemail. 2. Click the play button. What is the expected result? The voicemail should play out. What happens instead? The expected result sometimes occurs, sometimes it works only if I double click the play button. Sometimes I can't get the voicemail to play at all. Similar problems occur when attempting to pause the already playing voicemail, move forward in the voicemail, or go back in the voicemail. This problem has been around for as long as I've been using developer builds of Chromium for Mac.

title.$t: Crashes in WebKit::WebPopupMenuImpl::close()

content.$t:
I can't get stacks now, because I'm on the plane and am having a hard time 
using the VPN and crbug simultaneously.  I'l get stacks later.

Probably caused by r31195, the fix for bug 26311.  That may have also 
caused bug 27145.

I may need to bring bug 26876 into M4 for this, but it's possible that I can fix 
it by getting rid of the ShutdownHost call while keeping [cocoa_view_ release].

title.$t: Mac: find on NTP with detached bookmark bar causes visual cruft

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to the NTP and make sure the detached bookmark bar is displayed (Shift-Cmd-B if necessary). 2. Cmd-F to display the find bar (or is it a "box"?). (3. Cmd-F again to hide it, making the cruft more visible.) What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Nothing special is expected. Instead, we see a black (or green on a debug build) around/under the find bar. (On 10.5.8, on both the 4.0.245.0 dev channel release and on a local ToT debug build.)

title.$t: Javascript closing window while bookmark bubble open crashes

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open attached page 2. Immediately click on bookmark star 3. Wait until page closes behind you due to javascript What is the expected output? Everything should close properly. What do you see instead? Crash Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: bookmark folders not visible after 1st window

content.$t:
Open Chrome.  Add bookmark folder in bar.
Create new window --> folder icon gone!

title.$t: Consider adding Silverlight to the whitelist for beta

content.$t:
Since Silverlight now works, we should consider adding it to the whitelist for 
beta. We should watch the issue tracker and the crash server for a little while 
after the next dev channel before deciding, but filing now so we don't forget 
to make a conscious choice about it.

title.$t: Worker processes can be left in a zombie state

content.$t:
If you sit in a tight loop creating workers/reloading a page, eventually the 
process table fills up with zombie worker processes, and you can't create any 
more. I've attached my test that does this (dworker.html).

We need to reap these child processes when they exit.

title.$t: Silverlight : Going to fullscreen mode make dock and menu auto-hide

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: RohMac-2.local Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L30) Processor: 2 Intel 2.40 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 4.0.249.0 r32041 <<<Release>>> QuickTime Player: 7.6.4 QuickTime PlayerX: <unknown> Flash Player: 10.0.32 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Navigate to http://silverlight.net/learn/videos/all/silverlight-3-proxy-generation/. 2. Go to full screen mode. 3. Press esc to come back to normal playing mode. Expected result: 3.1 Dock and menu are visible and don't auto-hide. Actual result: 3.2 Dock and menu auto-hide. Quitting Chrome restores dock and menu in the right state.

title.$t: Mac: NTP detached bookmark bar border color regressed

content.$t:
In r32425 (which does the morph animation), I broke the border color (and 
presumably other colors as well), by ignoring existing alphas. E.g., on the 
default theme it displays as black (or is it a dark gray), whereas it should 
display as a mid-light gray.

See also issue 25600.

title.$t: Swahili is partially localized

content.$t: Platform: Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L31a) Processor: 2 Intel 2.33 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 4.0.249.4 r32475 Release QuickTime Player: 7.6.4 Flash Player: 10.0.32 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Change the system language to Swahili. 2. Restart Chrome. 3. Check the Main menu. Expected: Everything on the main menu should be in Swahili. title.$t: No active views for extensions after all windows have been closed on Mac

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.256.0 (Developer Build 32892) URLs (if applicable) : chrome://extensions/ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Visit chrome://extensions/ 2. Turn on developer mode 3. Install an extension with a background page You should see "Inspect active views:" and then a link to the background page. 4. Close all Chrome windows, but do not fully shut down the application Probably needs to be the Mac version for this to happen as a result. 5. Open a new window and go back to chrome://extensions/ It will no longer show any active views for the installed extensions. In addition, extension scripts will still run, but do not appear to be able to communicate with the background page anymore. Incidentally, inspecting the background page, then closing everything but the inspector keeps the background page alive, for whatever that's worth.

title.$t: Implement context menu for browser actions on mac

content.$t:
Browser actions should have a context menu in them with these three items:
- uninstall

title.$t: Chrome browser on Mac: Using NSEvent causes exceptions when running under Carbon event model.

content.$t: from Stuart Morgan at Google (stuartmorgan@google.com): In current Chrome Dev channel releases, where we don't support the Cocoa event model, right-clicking causes an exception from Flash Player trying to make Cocoa NSEvent calls (even though it's using the Carbon model.) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install Flash Player 2. Go to any website with Flash content. (e.g. www.youtube.com) 3. Right click a SWF What is the expected result? Chrome supports Cocoa event model so Flash Player will not throw an exception when making Cocoa NSEvent calls. What happens instead? Flash Player throws an exception when making Cocoa NSEvent calls. WORKAROUND: Do not right click on the SWF.

title.$t: [Mac] Implement context menu for browser actions and page actions

content.$t: This has been implemented on Windows and as tracked in issue 29538.

title.$t: Need to audit Windows-specific portions of sync code

content.$t:
While looking through the guts of the sync code, it looks like there's still a few 
places where we do "#if defined(OS_WIN)" and do nothing otherwise.  Some of 
these places look important.  I need to audit the code for these blocks to see 
what we're missing (for OS X at least).

title.$t: Cookie Manager doesn't auto selects the next cookie element after performing a delete

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go Chrome-->Preferences-->Under the hood->"Show cookies and website permissions" 2. Select the first cookie element from the list of entries 3. "Remove" button gets enabled --> Perform "Remove" Actual: The selected first cookie element gets deleted from cookies list and "Remove" button goes disabled. User should select manually the second entry to get the cookie removed from list. Expected: The next cookie entries should get auto selected after the previous one gets removed from list. Note: Windows: Auto selects the next cookie entry in the list and able to remove it with out manual select. Linux: Auto selects the next item in the cookie list and "Remove" button remains enabled . But cookie doesn't gets removed.

If you mouse over it, it says "Google Chrome" Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Strip RTL language localizations out of Chrome/Mac

content.$t:
OS X doesn't support RTL localized apps but the default language can still be 
set to Hebrew/Arabic in System Preferences->International.

If you do this your system will be borked in many interesting ways but things 
will still work and be in English.

However this completely messes up Chrome since we have localized strings 
and will display our UI in broken Hebrew.

This bug is to compile out Hebrew/Arabic strings on OS X till the OS adds 
support for localization in RTL languages.

Open above URL 2. Go in/out of Full-Screen mode a couple of times What is the expected result? SVG should redraw correctly What happens instead? SVG partially redraws

title.$t: [Mac] Clicking "Press tab to search" or page actions screws up omnibox selection.

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Bring up Chrome. 2. Start typing a site name for which a "Press tab to search xxx" is shown in the omnibox. 3. Click on the gray text for "Press tab to search xxx" 4. Press <tab> What is the expected output? - A box appears in the left portion of the omnibox with "Search xxx:" with the text insertion point immediately after and the light gray "Press tab to search xxx" being removed. What do you see instead? - No response other than the omnibox losing focus. Terms: site autocomplete

title.$t: Dragging and releasing tab quickly makes window disappear

content.$t:
Start with two windows, one tab in each.  Pick a window and start dragging its tab by the tab.  
Release the mouse immediately (before the overlay window is done flickering).  The window will 
flicker a few times and disappear.

Debugging showed that the window is actually being closed (not just going invisible) by a delayed 
call to Browser::CloseFrame().  Patching out http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?
view=rev&revision=36755 fixes the problem, although I don't understand why.

title.$t: Dragging tab causes window flicker

content.$t:
When dragging a window by a tab, various things happen behind the scenes to
make the window frame behind the tab translucent. In 5.0.223.0 (and perhaps
earlier) there's some shuddering as things redraw themselves.

title.$t: Fullscreen overlay disappears when dragging bookmark buttons around

content.$t:
Go fullscreen.  Make sure focus is not in the omnibox.  Open a folder on the bookmark bar.  Pick a 
button inside that folder and start dragging it around until you get the folder to close.  The overlay 
should stick around, even after the folder closes.

Patch coming.

title.$t: Improve scrolling performance

content.$t:
sbyer says that when you scroll:

a) We blit twice per screen update
b) We don't scroll but redraw everything

(a) is way more expensive and probably not too hard to fix. (b) is known (necessary when the find 
bar is open) and maybe not too expensive, but we might want to look into scrolling anyways if the 
find bar is closed.

We should look into this.

title.$t: Status bubble draws incorrectly in fullscreen mode

content.$t:
I suspect Avi's theming changes.

Since this is pretty visible (bubble is black instead of white, which makes the text unreadable), I 
suspect this should be fixed for the next beta.

title.$t: [Native Translator] There should be a manager option to manage chrome's native translator on Mac

content.$t:
There should be a default checked checkbox on the under the hood tab of
options labeled "Offer to translate pages that not in my language".

The checkbox should appear above the "Change font and languages" button.

(Same bug as 34520 but for Mac)

title.$t: tab opens in wrong window

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open 2 chrome windows. Let's call them A and B. 2. Show the bookmarks bar and give window A focus. 3. While window A has focus, cmd+click on a bookmark on window B's bookmark bar. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I expect a tab to open on window B and for window B to get focus. Instead, a new tab opens on window A and window A keeps focus.

title.$t: AutoFill preference string too long to fit on Mac

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch Chrome 2. Open Preferences 3. Navigate to Personal Stuff tab 4. Notice "Form autofill:" radio buttons. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expect: text of top radio button to fit on single line. Actual: the text "Enable AutoFill to fill in web forms with a single click" wraps to two lines. See: http://imgur.com/hlgeo

title.$t: Be consistent: page menus Encoding vs. View menus Text Encoding

content.$t:
In the page menu, weve got Encoding.

The same submenu in the View menu is called Text Encoding.

Lets pick one and stick with it.

title.$t: Mac notifications should match the mocks

content.$t:
Mac notifications need UI changes to match the mocks.

* Title bar height should be 16px (including the stroke at the bottom). that stroke should be 10% black. Title bar font should be 11px Lucida Grande.
* Close box should be the smaller, utility window style, 6px from the left edge, and 2px vertical padding from top/bottom edges of white.
* The mac version should not draw an outline around the notification at all, just draw a 6px radius round rectangle. 
* Wrench icon should be flipped around.

Chrome should go fullscreen; moving mouse to top should show overlay. Instead, chrome goes fullscreen but the menu stays visible, and the overlay does not appear. Doesn't happen in the 6.0.466.4 dev; also doesn't happen if fullscreen is toggled via cmd-shift-f

When you mouseover a page action, a little bubble pops up, and this bubble

title.$t: CFInstall.js doesn't allow to dismiss installation iframe

content.$t: Chrome Version : http://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/chrome- frame/1/CFInstall.min.js Other browsers tested: IE 6: Fail What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Add meta to opt in for Google Chrome Frame from http://code.google.com/chrome/chromeframe/developers_guide.html 2. Add CFInstall JavaScript code 3. Open page in IE6 4. Frame with instructions to install Google Chrome Frame cover the page and there is no way to cancel installation. What is the expected result? There should be a 'Cancel' button together with possibly 'X' button near the right top corner of the iframe (or in the div containing the iframe) that allows to cancel plugin installation and use page in IE. Rationale: Not everyone has administrator rights on their computer or even WANT to install another plugin. Maybe they want just to check out the page. Additional points for: - Adding a notification that the site may not look as expected when viewed without a plugin - Allow user to dismiss this dialog until next visit/never show this dialog again What happens instead? Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: Chrome Frame should accept X-UA-Compatible HTTP response header if the X-UA-Compatible meta is missing.

content.$t: Chrome Frame What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Send response header X-UA-Compatible: chrome=1;IE=Edge 2. View in IE8 with Google Chrome Frame installed. What is the expected result? Page should be rendered by Google Chrome Frame What happens instead? Page is rendered by IE8 Additional Information: An X-UA-Compatible response header should enable Chrome-Frame for IE8 but it doesn't seem that this works. HTTP servers may use the property name specified by the http-equiv attribute to create an [RFC822]-style header in the HTTP response <http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/struct/global.html#adef-http-equiv> The response header would be: X-UA-Compatible: chrome=1;IE=Edge IE8 w/out Chrome-Frame should render as IE8 with compatibility view button removed. IE8 w/ Chrome-Frame should render as Chrome with compatibility view button removed. http://groups.google.com/group/google-chrome-frame/t/91ee803e3147eb9b describes the issue regarding the use of meta tags. Note: I couldn't find any information on the priority of values in the X-UA-Compatible header. If chrome=1 is first and IE=Edge second should the browser render as Chrome or should chrome=1 be overridden by IE=Edge and thus render as IE? Also, I couldn't find any information on what to use as a value separator so I went with a semi-colon (though a comma should work as well [it does for cookies]).

title.$t: Opening meta tag URL as homepage in new tab doesn't render it in CF

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Make a webpage with the meta tag as homepage, http://go/cffull- facebook.html 2. Set this page such that it opens for a new tab Internet Options > General > Tabs settings > Check the option "Open homepage for new tab instead of blank page" 3. title.$t: chrome frame doesn't include full Chrome version number in UA

content.$t:
In order to enable UMA to differentiate version of GCF histogram data, we 
should include the full Chrome version number in the host UA, not only the 
major version (as we do today). e.g.:

    chromeframe/4.0

would become:

    chromeframe/4.0.255.12

title.$t: Visual refresh of the extension install UI

content.$t:
We need to do another refresh of the install dialog. There's been a general 
sentiment of unsatisfaction with the current design for the following 
reasons:

* eng would like something more extensible, so that things like geolocation 
could be slotted in easily without having to come up with a bunch more 
text.
* ui people have stated that the text sounds too vague.
* power users would like a more specific description of the permissions 
that are being requested.

I am sort of envisioning a short list of permissions in the dialog, each 
with a little icon and a short blurb explaining. There would be only a 
handful of possible permissions, like "browsing history", "physical 
location", "websites".

But it may be that it is not possible to do this in such a small space and 
we instead want to have a generic warning and a link to more information, 
or to expand the dialog.

Load a page that has the Chrome Frame meta-tag, thereby activating CF For example: http://www.sliceratwork.com/projects/cf-ie-update/index.html Note: This same behavior was observed for my own CF-enabled GWT page. Note also that IE resizes properly, even with CF installed, if not on a CF- enabled page, and Google Chrome browser also resizes correctly, whether on a CF-enabled page or not. title.$t: In IE8 when a new window is created in a ChromeFrame instance, it randomly bypasses the host network stack

content.$t:
This happens when a page rendered in ChromeFrame uses a window.open call
to create a new window. In this case we don't get control over the 
navigation as window.open calls expect to carry the opener relationship 
over to the new window. This basically means that navigation occurs in 
Chrome and the new tab/window created by the host attaches to the newly 
created ExternalTabContainer instance.

In IE8 the new tab opens in a new IE process, which basically uses a new 
automation channel to talk to Chrome. The host network stack implementation 
routes network requests issued by registered render views to the host 
browser over the automation channel. There is a timing window between the 
new window getting created and issuing network requests and the channel 
being established with the new iexplore instance. As a result network 
requests issued by the new window don't use the host network stack.

title.$t: ChromeFrame: cookie policy not honored in chrome Frame

content.$t:
In UrlRequestAutomationJob we consult chrome's cookie policy to see if we 
should set cookies or not. Since we don't set the preference to block third 
party cookies this is currently meaningless. Also, Darin is going to 
remove/revamp the cookie policy code so this is going to go away.

Ideally we should behave according to IE's cookie policy. Due to Darin's 
change, GetCookie from the renderer would be able to block. Then we would be 
able to request cookies from IE and correctly obey the cookie policy. This 
will also mean that we can get rid of bulk of profile wrapping hacks.

2. Shift + VK_BACK and Alt + VK_RIGHT to navigate forward.

Works fine on Stable.

title.$t: Initial requests created by a ChromeFrame popup window with host network stack enabled bypass the host network stack

content.$t:
Initial HTTP requests issued by a chrome frame popup window bypass
the host network stack. These requests are issued prior to the 
ExternalTabContainer getting notified about the new TabContents created to
handle the popup window.

content.$t:
Here's the test output:

[==========] Running 1 test from 1 test case.
[----------] Global test environment set-up.
[----------] 1 test from TaskManagerBrowserTest
[ RUN      ] TaskManagerBrowserTest.ReloadExtension
Got EXTENSION_LOADED notification.
Got EXTENSION_HOST_DID_STOP_LOADING notification.
Got EXTENSION_LOADED notification.
.\browser\task_manager_browsertest.cc(164): error: Value of: model()-
>ResourceCount()
  Actual: 2
Expected: 3

I'm not sure how long this has been happening for.

title.$t: Race condition between the AutomationHandle invalid notification and the TabProxy getting destroyed leads to a crash

content.$t:
The AutomationHandle invalid notification is processed on the background 
thread in ChromeFrame. The TabProxy is destroyed on the UI thread which
basically destroys the object maintained in the automation handle map leading
to a crash when the object is accessed while processing the Automation handle
invalidated notification.

title.$t: Title text of bg tabs too light

content.$t:
After the theming changes landed, the title text of background tabs is lighter than it was. Perhaps 
this is intentional and it was "fixed" to be correct, but it's worth investigating what we really want.

title.$t: dynamic enable/disable of sync data types

content.$t: Meta-bug tracking all required pieces.

title.$t: preferences sync too fast

content.$t:
This is not a feature.  We don't need an instant-messaging service, just a 
pref syncing service.

title.$t: Dragging file from desktop to bookmark bar DCHECKs and doesn't work

content.$t:
- drag a file from the content area to the bookmark bar in a browser window

expected:

- bookmark created for local file url

actual:

- in debug builds, it DCHECKs that the GURL that's created is invalid. This is because line 665 of 
bookmark_bar_controller.mm gets a path, not a file URL, so there's no protocol.
- continuing does nothing, no bookmark gets created.

i swear we already fixed this for the content area, or did before for creating bookmarks. This 
must have regressed at some point.

title.$t: [Content Settings] Inspecting image causes crash when images are blocked

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Have some extensions installed, e.g. top 30 most popular extensions 2. Check "Content Settings" -> "Do not show any images" 3. Access www.cnn.com, right click on the cnn logo image(blocked) and inspect it. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Pages crashes. Crash reported as http://crash/reportdetail?reportid=11332dbf7a0c4f40, but it seems there is no details in this crash report Issue detected in build 5.0.342.5 (Official Build 41542) Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: AppCache: anonymous event handlers go missing in action
chrome.experimental.history.query({startTime:0}) CHECKs

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Pass a startTime of 0, or another small integer (I also tested 2) 2. BOOM What is the expected output? No BOOM The weird thing is that I looked and we have a browser test for this and it is using a (bigger) integer value.

title.$t: Change "query" argument to "text" in chrome.experimental.history.query

content.$t:
This annoyed me last time I reviewed the API and I agreed to wait awhile and see if it still did. It still 
does.

title.$t: Use Mac specific strings

content.$t:
From b/2537015

Issue:
Chrome Mac frequently uses the same en-US source strings as Windows. 
However, Mac translations are different than Windows for menu items, so we 
need to create some new Mac-specific message strings. 

Solution:
1. Create new strings for the affected message IDs (listed in the trix), 
and note in the description that these are Mac-specific and require 
consistency with Mac terminology.
2. Determine if other strings need to be recreated too for Mac-specific 
translation. The strings listed in the bugs are Mac menu items. Do we have 
an easy way to determine all of the strings that are menu items?
3. Have the Chrome Mac build pull in these new translations instead of the 
current Windows strings.

Scroll What is the expected result? See attached testcase. I created this issue to merge Issue 39075 and Issue 38779 , as well as any related issues, while providing a simple testcase.

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.360.0 (Official Build 42309) dev What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open new tabbed bookmark manager 2. Search anything. Okay no problem. 3. Then try to search anything else. It doesn't search.

title.$t: preference sync falls into unrecoverable error if new pref is encountered

content.$t:
this seems quite bad, but I'm not sure what the right thing to do is.  Can we  
sync it under syncapi and instead ignore any pref item that isn't in 
synced_preferences_?

title.$t: [Content Settings] In incognito the set cookie prompt doesn't work properly

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Check "Content Settings" -> "Cookies" -> "Ask me when a site tries to set data", clear cookie exceptions and saved cookies 2. Open an incognito window, access a website like http://www.google.com What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Many problems now: 1. Option text is grey 2. Not able to remember the choice, in other words selection is not saved to exception list 3. Not able to save the cookie 4. etc The issue is detected with build 5.0.375.28 (Official Build 45883), it also happens in most early 375 build 5.0.375.1 (Official Build 44215), but doesn't happen in Stable and Beta channel build. This problem is probably happens in the same build with issue 42887, they are related. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: ChromeFrame fails to switch to chrome at times

content.$t:
I was able to reproduce this with OptinUrls set to *. This is unrelated to 
the actual problem though. 

Scenario as below:-
1. Navigate to https://webbranch.techcu.com
2. Login.
3. This then takes you to an intermediate page which requests additional 
info which then completes the login.

Step 2 initiates a form post request which initiates a page transition. In 
the meantime chrome also sends over an open url request to the new URL 
which chrome frame handles by invoking IWebBrowser2::Navigate. The BHO sets 
the top level url in the navigation manager in this context.

The top level url in the navigation manager is used by the moniker patch to 
decide whether to wrap the callback or not. The post request mentioned in 
Step 2 also sends over the transition info to chrome which then is sent to 
chrome frame to update the navigation state. Here we also have code to set 
the URL in the navigation manager.

The problem occurs if the transition info is sent over after the navigation 
request which overwrites the URL in the navigation manager. This causes us 
to not wrap the callback thus causing us to not switch.

title.$t: Reload/Stop button deformed (left side square, not rounded)

content.$t: Chrome Version : 6.0.433.0 (49620) 1. Navigate to Any webpage. 2. The Stop button has a straight line on the leftside rather than curved to match the other buttons. 3. Reload 4. Any theming shows a bright white line on the left rather than a smoothly curved and colored button. What is the expected result? The omnibox should have a complete boarder on all sides and should be rounded to look like the back/forward buttons and the stop/reload button. The stop button mode of the newly combined stop/reload has a squared off line on the left side that messes up themeing. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: Re-encrypt sync nodes on passphrase change

content.$t: Whenever the sync passphrase changes, we should re-encrypt all the password sync nodes with the new passphrase.

title.$t: Typo means that about:sandbox incorrectly reports network isolation

content.$t: Fixed in r53180. This bug is just to keep track of the fact that it needs to be merged in for M6.

title.$t: hide the new cookie dialogs behind a command line switch

content.$t: introduce --disable-cookie-prompt

title.$t: Set Up Sync dialog needs work

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to prefs 2. Personal Stuff Tab 3. Sync Button What is the expected output? Page matches other prefs windows, font sizes are smaller. What do you see instead? Page is white, buttons don't look native, fonts are too large. Wording is poor, need to remove 'If need be' I realize this is a hosted page, but I don't know the right place to file this, so for now tracking it here.

title.$t: Adjust text on update notification dialog

content.$t:
Not sure if a bug has been filed for this already.

We agreed at the go/no-go meeting last week to rewrite the text on the update notification dialog. In particular, we should remove the phrase "Old school's not cool".

Brian, did you want to take a stab at re-writing this?

Assigning to Cole for now because he owns the "settings" UI (I think). After we decide the text, please assign to finnur or sky.

title.$t: Test 'set default browser' checkbox in the download page.

content.$t: With the new FRUI, chrome is by default set as default browser. This behavior is temporary. Users will be provided with an option to change this in the download page. This is a tracking bug to verify this when the change is available.

title.$t: updating v8 from 5214 to 5242 causes LastPass SHA256 hashing code to fail

content.$t:
http://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/group/chromium-extensions/browse_thread/thread/4326be8ce8a523e5

The test page is here:

https://rodan.lastpass.com/dev/nightly_problem.php

They claim that if that page reports "incorrect: 0" at the bottom, then that means the bug is present. I used our build/build-bisect.py script to track this down to:

http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=55850

which updates v8 in DEPS from 5214 to 5242

title.$t: Pull Google Feedback from M7 before the beta release on 9/20

content.$t: Since we have not resolved the bug of Chrome feedback going into the Chrome OS bucket, and the Chrome feedback UI needs to be improved (55652), we should pull Google Feedback before M7 goes to beta.

title.$t: Chrome 7.0.517.5 dev mangles Flash embed code in the DOM when the .swf extension is not used - e.g. YouTube embeds are affected

content.$t: Chrome Version : 7.0.517.5 (Official Build 59018) dev URLs (if applicable) : http://tomorrowmorning.net/flash_test/youtube.html http://tomorrowmorning.net/flash_test/example.html Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 5: OK Firefox 3.x: OK IE 7: OK IE 8: OK CHROME 6.x: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to http://tomorrowmorning.net/flash_test/youtube.html in Chrome 7.0.517.5 2. Open the developer console (Ctrl+Shift+J) What is the expected result? You should see the original embedding code - with the <object> and <embed> tags with all their original values. This is the same code that you see using View Source (Ctrl+U). What happens instead? The <object> and <embed> tags get transformed. The <object> tag erroneously contains child <html> and <body> tags for example. This problem does not occur in Chrome 6.x and lower. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. This bug has some destructive outcomes, beyond adding erroneous <html> and <body> tags to the DOM. It also strips the original embedding code of any information about the Flashvars parameter used to pass variables into the Flash movie. Example: 1. Go to http://tomorrowmorning.net/flash_test/example.html in Chrome 7.0.517.5 What is the expected result? The Flashvars should be read by both movies on the page and displayed in the movie. What happens instead? The variables are only available to the Flash movie which is embedded with the ".swf" extension. The <object> and <embed> tags are stripped of any information about the flashvars in the DOM.

title.$t: Security: download shelf question for themes from untrusted locations is not honest

content.$t:
As we debated in e-mail:

- Hit a .crx theme file in Beta from an untrusted location, e.g.
http://cevans-app.appspot.com/static/theme.crx

- The download shelf says that this file can harm my computer and offers 
"Save" and "Discard"

- "Save" is extremely misleading. It not only downloads the file to my 
local disk but also runs it, i.e. installs the theme. This is 
unprecedented.

Fix could be as simple as changing the "Save" button to "Install Theme"? 
Honesty about what that button does in IMHO critical.

title.$t: "Downloads in progress, quit?" dialog needs better text

content.$t:
1. Start a download
2. Hit cmd-q

Expected: Some explanatory text in both heading and detail text
Actual: Heading says "Alert"

See
http://developer.apple.com/documentation/userexperience/Conceptual/A
ppleHIGuidelines/XHIGWindows/XHIGWindows.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/2
0000961-BACFBACB

title.$t: Rename chrome.extension.getTabContentses() => getExtensionTabs().

content.$t:
Nobody understand what it does as currently named.

We will of course need to alias the current name.

title.$t: Automatically convert user scripts to extensions

content.$t:
For background, see bug 16344.

We should be able to transparently support Greasemonkey user scripts by 
converting them into extensions at install time.

That way, we don't have to maintain two separate systems forever -- we just 
have a small compatibility shim at install time.

Design doc: http://code.google.com/p/chromium/wiki/DealingWithGreasemonkey

title.$t: We should validate the path of the background page

content.$t:
If you mistype the value of "background_pagee" in the manifest, it loads the 
404 handler into it.

Funny, but not so useful.

Extra check needs to go into extension_file_util::Validate(). We need to 
change Extension to store the relative path instead of the full URL.

title.$t: chrome_url_overrides doesn't work with packed extension

content.$t:
Creating an extension that overrides the new tab page works when you load the 
unpacked version. When you pack it and install the .crx, it gets the url 
wrong.

title.$t: Update samples to use browser or page actions

content.$t: We should update all the public samples to use browser and page actions.

title.$t: The gmail checker sample should not show a badge if there are zero unread messages

content.$t: That is all

title.$t: New Yahoo mail doesn't work with ChromeFrame

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Set OptInUrls to include *yahoo.com* 2. Navigate to mail.yahoo.com and log in 3. If you are using new yahoo mail, you'll see yahoo mail can't load. Click on the link "Click here to try again" If yahoo classic is being used try switching to new yahoo mail What is the expected output? Yahoo mail should be rendered completely What do you see instead? It doesn't render completely. It works fine in Chrome245 and IE without CF. Happening with ChromeFrame 4.0.245.0 (Official Build 31763)

title.$t: Content scripts doc bug

content.$t:
http://code.google.com/chrome/extensions/content_scripts.html

The example code says that both the page and the content script can set 
things like foo.onclick and that both events will get fired. Alas, this is 
not true today. The docs should be changed to reflect the reality.

title.$t: Implement printing on Linux

content.$t: Subject says it all.  See the Windows code for reference.

title.$t: Some fonts in developer tools are ugly/unreadable

content.$t:
It was all designed on Macs, surely.
We should tweak the CSS to be more Linux-friendly in its fallbacks.

See screenshot:
- monospace too big (might be that I tweaked a setting in a bad way?)
- exception font against red is bad

title.$t: Scary download UI for extensions needs polish (linux)

content.$t:
The text is weird for extension install. It should be: Extensions can harm 
your computer. Are you sure you want to continue? [Continue] [Discard].

See also: bug 23105.

title.$t: Bookmark buttons's adaptive size sometimes too small

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.196 URLs (if applicable) : OS version : 10.5.7 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Bookmark something, open the bookmarks bar 2. right-click, edit 3. Rename the bookmark to "test" What is the expected result? Bookmark button should say "test". What happens instead? It says "t", probably because it's a few pixels too short.

title.$t: Omnibox should be a little bit transparent

content.$t:
The omnibox would look and feel more like the Mac if it were a little bit 
transparent.  It shouldn't be very transparent.  Just a little bit.

See the URL bar and search dropdowns in Safari and Camino.  Also, see native 
OS popups.

This should be a simple matter of setting the alpha value after picking the 
right number.

This is omnibox polish like bug 20283 for drop shadows.

title.$t: Line spacing in the about box could use some attention

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Chrome:About Google Chrome 2. Look at it What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Observe: Copyright 2006-2009 Google Inc. All Rights Reserved. Google Chrome is made possible by the Chromium open source project and other open source software. Google Chrome Terms of Service Expect: Copyright 2006-2009 Google Inc. All Rights Reserved. Google Chrome is made possible by the Chromium open source project and other open source software. Google Chrome Terms of Service (Not a whole blank line between the two sections, but a little bit of space.) There's a little bit of extra space between these sections in the Windows about box. Actually, the Windows about box kind of looks crappy for another reason: there's one more pixel between the baselines of the second and third lines in the first section than there is between the baselines of the first two lines. Let's assume that's an accident and not strive to duplicate it. Please use labels and text to provide additional information. 4.0.206.0 trunk r25138 I really like the new about box, by the way.

your computer. Are you sure you want to continue? [Continue] [Discard].

title.$t: Padlock failed to show Security Information dialog for SSL protected sites.

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: testings-macbook-pro-15.local Mac OS X Version 10.6.1 (Build 10B504) Processor: 2 Intel 2.33 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chromium: Chromium version: 4.0.219.5 SNV Revision: 27415 <<<Release>>> QuickTime Player: <unknown> Flash Player: 10.0.32 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Navigate to an SSL protected site 2. Click the padlock in the address bar . What is the expected output? Get the security information dialog. Actual: Nothing show up. Note: Windows and Mac gives the Information. This is Mac specific. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Cancelling extension Install failed.

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: testings-macbook-pro-15.local Mac OS X Version 10.6.1 (Build 10B504) Processor: 2 Intel 2.33 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 4.0.219.7 <<<Release>>> QuickTime Player: <unknown> Flash Player: 10.0.32 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to chromeextras using Chrome. 2. Select any extension. (ie. GMail Checker) 3. Click on Install 4. Click on 'Cancel' button on confirmation dialog. What is the expected output? Extension is not installed. What do you see instead? Extension Install. You can see in Installed stuff entry in extension control page. Note: Cancellation performs well both on Linux and Windows. This is Mac specific.

title.$t: Figure out the ownership model for web content <select> pop-up menus
Bookmark Manager: Clearing search results should re-focus the pre-search focus

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Hit cmd-f 2. type in something 3. Hit esc to cancel the search What is the expected result? Should re-focus what was focused before the search started (e.g. the "Bookmarks Bar" folder). What happens instead? The empty "Search results" "folder" stays focused.

title.$t: Bookmark Manager: Buttons are missing tooltips
Cookie Manager: On removal of last cookie auto select the previous one.

content.$t:
Platform:
  Hostname: testings-macbook-pro-15.local
  Mac OS X Version 10.6.2 (Build 10C540)
  Processor: 2 Intel 2.33 GHz
  RAM: 2048 MB

Chrome:
  Chrome version: 4.0.305.0 r36956  <<<Release>>>
  QuickTime Player: <unknown>
  QuickTime PlayerX: 90.3.1
  Flash Player: 10.0.42.34

Precondition:  Have few cookies stored on your computer.

1. Go Chrome-->Preferences-->Under the hood->"Show cookies and website permissions"
2. Select the last cookie element from the list of entries, and perform "Remove"

Actual: Last cookie gets deleted and "Remove" button goes disabled. User has to auto select manually the above cookie element in the list.

Expected: Auto select the previous cookie when the last cookie in the list got removed. ( Windows behavior )


Also applies to :
==========

1. Expand a domain in the list, select the "Cookies" folder and perform "Remove"
Expected: It should auto select the domain name. ( Windows behavior )
Actual: "Remove" button goes disabled.

1. Expand a domain in the list, From the "Cookies" folder, select the last child and perform "Remove"
Expected: It should auto select the "Cookies" folder ( Windows behavior )
Actual: "Remove" button goes disabled.

title.$t: Merge minor patches into stable tree

content.$t:
The following patches need to be merged for Chrome 6:

r53505 (a very minor security issue)

STS cleanups
r53645
r53644
r53508

title.$t: Load testing for viewvc solution for extension docs

content.$t:
Investigate what kind of load viewvc can stand for hosting the extension 
docs. If insufficient, come up with a plan for putting a cache in front of 
it.

Note that a simple frontend might make sense anyway, as we could put the 
canonical home of the docs on, eg, chrome.google.com.

title.$t: Implement popups for page actions

content.$t: Page actions should have popups, just like browser actions

title.$t: chrome.browserAction.setIcon({imageData:...}) should limit image size to 19px square

content.$t:
Right now it allows larger sizes. See the gmail_checkre_browser_action sample 
as an example of this.

title.$t: process id's in task manager are wrong for renderer processes

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.203.2 (Official build 24690) OS + version : Ubuntu 9.04 CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 32 bit window manager : Gnome 2.26.1 URLs (if applicable) : What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open 3 or more tabs 2. Open chrome's task manager and view the process ids of each tab 3. In a terminal, issue 'ps aux | grep chrome' What is the expected result? The pids corresponding to the renderer processes are in sync with the output of the ps command What happens instead? The pids in Chrome task manager are different Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot and backtrace if possible. Also happening in Fedora 11 and Open SuSe 11.1

content.$t: Chrome Version : <include svn revno; e.g. dpkg -s chromium-browser> OS + version : Ubuntu 9.04 CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 32 window manager :Gnome URLs (if applicable) :www.ct24.cz Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): is ok Behavior in Chrome for Windows (optional): is ok Flash Player install Run as: chromium-browser --enable-plugins What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.page www.ct24.cz - Aw. Snap! 2. 3. What is the expected result? View Aw. Snap! page What happens instead? Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot and backtrace if possible.

title.$t: "Show all downloads" should use BrowserThemeProvider::COLOR_BOOKMARK_TEXT

content.$t:
See DownloadShelfView::Layout(). Without this, "Show all downloads" is not 
readable with some themes.

title.$t: Implement page actions on mac

content.$t:
This NOTIMPLEMENTED() accounts for 10% of the total output of ui_tests.  Turning it into a tracking 
bug.

title.$t: Browser actions: implement resize behavior

content.$t:
You should be able to resize the region that contains the browser actions. 
This will sometimes result in overflow, but I'm going to create a different 
bug for that.

title.$t: video killed the text/plain star

content.$t:
Found in:  Google Chrome 3.0.182.2 (You need a build with video enabled and 
codec dlls.)

Open a page that is content-type text/plain. 
http://codereview.chromium.org/download/issue113812_1.diff will work.

Instead of seeing text, you get video/audio controls.

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.182.2 URLs (if applicable) : about:credits Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: N/A Firefox 3.x: N/A IE 7: N/A IE 8: N/A Chrome 3.0.182.2 includes the FFmpeg libraries avcodec-52.dll, avformat- 52.dll, and avutil-50.dll but FFmpeg (and some sort of link to the source code) is missing from about:credits

title.$t: Breakpad missing from OS X build

title.$t: REGRESSION: Content not drawn for background-opened tabs

content.$t: Chrome Version: 4.0.208.0 (25857) Other browsers tested: Safari 4: OK Firefox 3.x: OK IE 7: OK Opera 10: OK Google Chrome 3.0.195.17: OK K-Meleon 1.5.3: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? Open content in background tabs (e.g., I Ctrl+click on a link) and then moving to those tabs either by clicking on the tab or kb shortcut. Once I force a redraw, e.g. by "restoring" the chromium window from maximized to windowed size, the current broken screen will repaint properly & once I've done that for that tab, that tab is no longer broken although other tabs still may be broken until I force a redraw on those, as well. What is the expected result? When I click on a tab that is not currently up front (or Ctrl+Tab to one or even Alt+Tab to another maximized chromium window), I expect to see the content of that tab. What happens instead? I see the content of whatever was painted on the screen last. This could be the last tab, it could be menu a menu from something in the taskbar, etc. Note: the text in the tab & the address bar of the broken tab correctly shows the title of the page that *should* be drawn as well as the correct URL. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. I only started noticing this when I grabbed the latest build as of last night (I think I had gone from build 253xx to 258xx). I first saw issue while Chromium is maximized, but it doesn't have to be in a maximized window. I've seen this in full screen, as well, but it isn't 100% reproducible I've seen this on 32-bit Vista Ultimate SP2 & 32-bit XP Pro. Screenshots attached. In repaint_bug_screenshot1.png, notice that I'm currently on the 2nd tab from the left (should be seeing http://www.mail- archive.com/chromium-bugs@googlegroups.com/msg30315.html in that tab, as shown in the tab text and the address bar). Also, notice the greenshot menu showing in the bottom right. Greenshot is what I used to take a screenshot of the chromium window, the menu was not actually open when the screenshot was taken, this bug just doesn't repaint the screen. In repaint_bug_screenshot2.png, I've moved numerous windows from other programs over the area.

title.$t: Autocomplete dropdown no longer goes away on return

content.$t:
- go to a page where you have autocomplete webform entries, such as 
http://crbug.com
- type in a text field and see autocomplete entries
- arrow down, hit return

expected:
- autocomplete dropdown should go away after completing.

actual:
- dropdown does not go away. The only way to make it go away is to de-
focus the window.

This makes the browser very difficult to dogfood. Appears to be mac-only, 
not sure when this regressed.

title.$t: Renderer crash @ WebCore::PopupContainer::hidePopup

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.213.0 - Build 26910 URLs (if applicable) : http://www.gmail.com Other browsers tested: Firefox, Opera, Konqueror and Chromium on a old version (another machine - Using it right now) Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: - Firefox 3.x: OK IE 7: - IE 8: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open http://www.gmail.com 2. Write your username 3. Press TAB to right your password 4. You won't need another step cause this is enough to show you the problem. Just try to login your gmail account. What is the expected result? Login in my email account and check my emails. What happens instead? An error page asking me to reload the page. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. I got the same problem in my personal email that I use with google apps too.

title.$t: JSON unit_tests are disabled because they started crashing after a WebKit deps roll

content.$t:
A webkit roll (http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?
view=rev&revision=27139) caused http://chrome-
buildbot.corp.google.com:8010/builders/Mac10.5%20Tests%20(dbg)(2)/build
s/5465/steps/unit_tests/logs/stdio to happen.  It believe it's because of 
http://trac.webkit.org/changeset/48732

sudden termination calls go back to the WebKitClient.  It looks like the client 
is null at the time.

title.$t: Inspecting any page causes renderer crash

  ASSERT_WITH_MESSAGE(0, "unimplemented propertyID: %d", propertyID);

title.$t: REGRESSION: 70% Memory Jump On Perf

content.$t:
http://build.chromium.org/buildbot/perf/xp-release-single-
core/intl1/report.html?history=150&graph=vm_peak_r&rev=-1

Here are possible offenders:

http://build.chromium.org/buildbot/perf/dashboard/ui/changelog.html?
url=/trunk/src&range=38477:38486&mode=html

Since SPDY is not yet running and most others are benign/OS-specific, 
http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=38479 is the 
likeliest culprit.

Thanks to jar@ for pointing it out.

[Environment]
\\chrome-master.mtv\shared\5.0.332.0\win
Windows XP
Google Chrome	5.0.332.0 (Official Build 39309) unknown
WebKit	533.1
V8	2.1.0.1
User Agent	Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US) 
AppleWebKit/533.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/5.0.332.0 Safari/533.1


[Steps]
1) Client A and B are already connected to sync server 
2) Disable network (network is not available - offline)
3) Client A: Add bookmark

[Actual Result]
Chrome crashes

[Note]
Chrome crashes also when
At step3-Delete already existed bookmark or create a new folder

No dump file was generated for this failure

title.$t: Cant tab away from <select> pop-ups that have been opened, breaks other content keys like backspace, arrows, back/forward, etc.

content.$t:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Visit any page that has a <select> pop-up, such as this one 
(http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/entry).

2. Click on a <select> pop-up and make a choice.

3. Press tab.

Observed result: focus stays on the <select> pop-up.

Expected result: focus should advance to the next element.

This regressed in the 371 dev build.  The problem is still present in 375.6.

title.$t: networking stack seems to be failing in http auth case

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Load http://www.pagetutor.com/keeper/http_authentication/index.html 2. Click 'My Secret Stuff ' What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Page just spins and spins, never loads. The spinner is the reverse spinner, so I believe that means we're sitting down in the network layers, not even getting anything back. r26351 fails like this r26220 has no problems

title.$t: <select> elements not always working on Mac nightlies

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.219.0 (27028) URLs (if applicable) : http://apple.com/feedback OS version : 10.6.1 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): OK Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): OK Behavior in Chrome for Windows: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Click a selection box. 2. Change the item selected What is the expected result? New selection is "selected" What happens instead? Old selection stays. Select box becomes unclickable.

title.$t: Crashes while attaching files to Gmail.com messages in latest nightlies.

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.221.4 (27966) URLs (if applicable) : https://mail.gmail.com/ OS version : 10.6.1 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Compose a new message in Gmail 2. Attach an image to the message using the standard attachment tool What is the expected result? The file will be attached as expected, upload progressing, etc. What happens instead? Chrome crashes As far as I can tell this issue is site specific.

title.$t: Official builds want to update on the com.google.Chrome.framework ID - the .framework part is wrong

content.$t:
I messed this up in r28963.  tweak_app_infoplist sets the KSProductID value to 
the value of CFBundleIdentifier in the plist that it's working on.  I moved 
KSProductID from the outer app's Info.plist into the framework's Info.plist.  
The two have different bundle identifiers.

If we release something with this bug, it can cause users to fall off of the 
auto-update train.

title.$t: Environment variables are no longer set for child processes

content.$t:
The change in bug 27935 causes environment variables to be lost before they are set for child 
processes. I'm not sure if Linux used this, but on the Mac it means that our plugin interpose library 
isn't loaded, which means lots of important plugin window handling code never runs.

This regresses a number of beta-blocker plugin bugs. I would strongly recommend this be 
ReleaseBlock-Dev in addition to beta.

title.$t: KeystoneRegistration 1.0.7.1306 tag path and tag key

content.$t:
I need to make some minor code changes to take advantage of the tag path
and tag key support that Keystone 1.0.7.1306 adds.

title.$t: BS and TAB stop working for certain tabs

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.375.9 dev OS version : 10.6.3 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. casual browsing with form filling (sorry I can't be more specific - it's happened to me twice now on two different Macs - appears to be related to 10.6.3 update, chrome update or one of the small number of extensions I have installed - FlashBlock, AdBlock, goo.gl shortener + share on twitter and Google Translate). What is the expected result? Tab and backspace should always work. What happens instead? Tab, backspace (and possibly others - eg arrows) stop working altogether. Users have to use the mouse to navigate the form and highlight text to replace it.

title.$t: Dragging text between text fields only works once.

content.$t:
- visit http://new.crbug.com which has multiple text fields
- type some text in the summary field
- drag a word from summary and drop on description, this should work as expected (word is moved 
between text fields
- do it again

expected:
- same thing, word is moved between text fields

actual:
- word vanishes from summary and never appears in description.
- if you drag from description to summary, it sad tabs.
- sometimes I can't even start a drag in the summary field, may be unrelated or a side-effect of things 
getting horked.

This is bad and a release blocker. Happens both on ToT (44452) and 375.16. Mark says he couldn't repro 
in the release 375@45009, but didn't know the exact steps at the time and then lost that build. Now he's 
on 375@45061 and it's for sure happening. Maybe it's a recent regression?

Not sure if it's all platforms. Krisr, can you try to repro on others?

Dragging to PasteboardPeeker always shows the proper output, so it must be something internal to 
webkit's handling of the drop.

title.$t: Delete, backspace, and arrows are sent to a <select> popup even once dismissed

content.$t:
Bug 41390 follow-up.  The fix for bug 41390 is incomplete on the trunk.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Go to a page with <select> popups and text fields.
2. Use a <select> popup.  Make a choice.  Close it.
3. Focus a text field.
4. Enter some text.  Try to use the delete, backspace, and arrow keys.

Expect: Once the pop-up is not focused, the keys behave appropriately for their context.

Observe: The keys have no effect.  Theyre being sent to the closed and defocused popup.

Note that if you use the up and down arrow keys, you will cycle through the available selections 
in the popup, indicating that the keys are being sent to the popup.

You dont actually need to be in a text entry field to experience this problem.  Using the arrow 
keys when the page as a whole has focus is supposed to scroll the page, but it doesnt.  Using the 
backspace key when the page as a whole has focus is supposed to go back in history, but it 
doesnt.

I see this bug on the trunk at r45196 and verified its still present at r45209.  pinkerton saw it it 
r45187.  These are all after r45154, when WebKit DEPS were rolled past r57891 to pick up the fix 
for https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=37721.

I dont see this bug on the 375 branch at r45188, which is after what I thought was the 
equivalent fix landed at r44989.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Small font, no menu labels if app_locale == 'en'

content.$t:
I updated to trunk build 19219 and there were no locale resources loaded. 
The default font for web pages was ~1pt and no menus had strings.

I believe this is caused by http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?
view=rev&revision=19183

I discovered that the following lines in User Data\Local Settings cause the 
issue:

   "intl": {
      "app_locale": "en"
   },

[n.b. Changing "en" to "en-US" works.]

It's possible that r19183 has just uncovered a latent bug. Perhaps before 
we were failing with locale=en and defaulting to locale="en-US".

Now, it looks like we're just failing to find en.dll and resorting to "no 
locale at all".

I believe a lot of users have app_locale=en in Local Settings, so this is a 
Dev release blocker.

title.$t: Merge generated c files (from webcore idls) to a single compile unit

content.$t:
We currently have link failures because webcore.lib is too large in official 
WPO builds. We need to reduce the size of webcore.lib, in the short term, the 
easiest way is to simply split it in two.

Also waiting on Microsoft for a fix but will probably require switching to 
VS2008 which adds its own issues.

title.$t: LNK1106 errors on windows official builders

content.$t:
This seems to be a somewhat frequent problem, linking webcore.lib with 
whole program optimization on the windows official builders.

The error message is:

122>C:\b\slave\chrome-official-2\build\src\chrome\Release\lib\webcore.lib : 
fatal error LNK1106: invalid file or disk full: cannot seek to 0x644CF818

and it has occurred at least on the two most recent dev channel builds 
(4.0.270.0, 4.0.271.0). For the 271 build, which started on 12/15 at 3am, 
the host (cr-official5.mtv) had been rebooted at 2:30am in order to start 
with a known environment as much as possible.

failed, 4.0.270.0, started 12/14 @ 11:45a
http://chrome-
master.mtv.corp.google.com:8010/builders/chrome%20official%202/builds/615/s
teps/compile/logs/stdio

failed, 4.0.271.0, started 12/15 @ 3a
http://chrome-
master.mtv.corp.google.com:8010/builders/chrome%20official%202/builds/619/s
teps/compile/logs/stdio

A similar bug was logged (and marked fixed) in 
http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=23957

It is very interesting that on the same build host cr-official5, the 
4.0.249.42 build - built 12/14 at 7p - compiled successfully, and leads me 
to believe there is a specific issue with the code as the builder was able 
to complete successfully for a beta build (and failed on the two dev 
channel builds). Unfortunately I do not know exactly when this failure 
started happening as we have been dealing with multiple failures on the 
windows official builders.

success, 4.0.249.42, started 12/14 @ 7p
http://chrome-
master.mtv.corp.google.com:8010/builders/chrome%20official%202/builds/618

title.$t: REGRESSION: Chromium fails the acid 3 test due to :link/:visited privacy changes

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.379.0 (44714) URLs (if applicable) : http://acid3.acidtests.org/ Other browsers tested: Safari and Chromium 4 (which includes Chrome 4) pass the test without any rendering issues Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4:OK Firefox 3.x:Fail IE 7:Fail IE 8:Fail What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go on Acid 3 test (http://acid3.acidtests.org/) 2. 3. What is the expected result? The browser should render the test perfectly, as it has done before in Chromium 4. What happens instead? The browser displays the text "YOU SHOULD NOT SEE THIS AT ALL" in red on the top of the page. This shows that Chromium 5 has failed the rendering portion of the test. Chromium seems to pass other portions of the test. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.
