title.$t: [Extensions] Chrome crashes when installing extension "AniWeather" @ ResourceMessageFilter::OnGetCookies

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install Dev candidate 5.0.317.0 2. Try to install extension "AniWeather" from official gallery site What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Chrome crashes, and subsequent launches also crash. This doesn't happen in current Dev build 5.0.307.1 (Official Build 37331), it is a regression issue and a release blocker.

title.$t: Internal sites don't open and opening any of them locks all other tabs

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: RohMac-2.local Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L30) Processor: 2 Intel 2.40 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 5.0.375.3 r44229 <<<Release>>> QuickTime Player: 7.6.4 QuickTime PlayerX: <unknown> Flash Player: 10.0.45.2 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Visit to google.com 2. Visit to internal mail site using shortcut DNS. Result: 1.1 Browsing google.com or yahoo.com works fine. 1.2 Browser tabs stop rendering the pages after opening any internal site and eventually all tabs get locked. Note: - I have attached GDB BT for all threads.

title.$t: sync stalls on browser restart

content.$t:
A bug in a recent patch makes the SyncerThread Start() call happen *only* when the user chooses data types.  If this has previously happened, syncing will never start.

offending patch: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=50902

Fix is straightforward enough.
ProfileSyncService::Startup needs to check kHasSyncSetupCompleted
if it has, 
(1) install DataTypeManager, call GetPreferredTypes, call Configure
(2) Either PSS or DTM needs to start the syncer thread

There's also bug 47770, which has a similar straightforward fix, but we could consider rolling back the patch.

title.$t: Downloading is troublesome; incomplete files, broken pause

content.$t: Product Version : 0.2.149.27 (1583) URLs (if applicable) : N/A Other browsers tested: N/A Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 3: N/A Firefox 3: N/A IE 7: N/A What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Download Chrome sources (http://build.chromium.org/buildbot/archives/chromium.tgz) 2. Pause 3. Resume What is the expected result? It's expected to resume the download. What happens instead? Chrome thinks that it's finished, stops downloading Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. This happened to me twice: once doing pause, the other just random. (below happened the time I used the pause button) It might be worth noting that I accidentally tried to open the file being downloaded -- but it said, "Will open in 49 minutes" (when it's complete, I guess). Not sure if this had anything to do with it.. (below happened at random) The file just completed. It was at 36.6mb.. I have no clue what happened, it just .. finished.

What is the expected result? chinese font should be displayed in the correct way What happens instead? the font size for simplified chinese is extremely small, unreadable Please provide any additional information below. title.$t: Gears Crash @ `anonymous namespace'::CPB_PluginThreadAsyncCall

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to gmail.com 2. Login and click on offline 3. Click on next, select the check box and click on Allow Gears 0.5.21.0 crash with Chromium 3.0.189.0 (Developer Build 18543). Call Stack ----------- 01aef9e4 65071fef chrome_1c30000!`anonymous namespace'::CPB_PluginThreadAsyncCall+0xc 01aefa08 65072101 gears!NP_Initialize+0x52e7f 01aefa2c 6500105a gears!NP_Initialize+0x52f91 01aefa3c 65078925 gears+0x105a 01aefa88 65078e08 gears!CP_Initialize+0x5085 00000000 00000000 gears!CP_Initialize+0x5568 From b/1922007

title.$t: Shortcuts for user level install are being created for all users instead of creating them for just that user

content.$t:
Install user-level Chromium 3.0.190.0 (Developer Build 18617)

See that the shortcuts in Start > All Programs for Chromium are created @ C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Chromium. Looks as if it's 
considering this install as system-level. They should be created @ 
C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Chromium

On uninstall, these shortcuts remain.

title.$t: Bookmark's Drop-Down/Context menu is black

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.190.0 (18726) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Have a folder for bookmarks on the Bookmark bar, populated with bookmarks 2. Click on the folder to open it What is the expected result? Viewable list of bookmarks What happens instead? Folders show up black Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. Running Win7 RC x64.

title.$t: Downloads page fails to list the downloads

content.$t:
ToT(r 19584)

-Download a file in normal window.
-Ctrl+J to downloads page

Notice the downloaded file is not listed in the downloads page.

Marking this as DEV Release Block.

title.$t: Tab closes, if a new url is navigated on page loading

content.$t:
ToT(r19942)

-Navigate to a page which takes longer time to load. While page is loading, 
navigate to different page.

Before the 2nd page rendering is committed, the tab closes. If you have 
single tab opened, then browser window closes in this case.

Marking this as DEV release blocker.

PS: this happens to me consistently.

title.$t: Chome is not launched after FRUI, if 'customize these settings' is launched

content.$t:
ToT(r20262)

-Launch the installer and Click on the link 'Customize these settings' on 
FRUI.
-Click on 'Start Chromium' button.

Notice, the imports are successfully imported, but the browser window is not 
launched. If you don't click on 'Customize these settings' link, then browser 
window is launched after imports.

Marking this Release DEV blocker.

content.$t:

   OS: Windows, not test on Mac and Linux yet

Other Browsers:

           IE8: N/A

1. Launch Chrome
2. Go to any web page, say, google.com
3. Hover mouse to anywhere of the page
4. Observe

Result:
There will be a white rectangle showing next to the cursor

Expected:
Should not display the extra rectangle

Notes:
This issue happens on NNTP, history and downloads page as well

Repros on XP and Win-7.

Notice, as shown in the screenshot, mouse pointer shadow(?) is shown just
underneath the mouse pointer.

title.$t: Browser crash @ TemplateURLTableModel::GetText()

content.$t:
Not sure, how we missed this, but it is unfortunate to know that, the crash 
happens on Beta release candidate (3.0.193.2), DEV, Trunk.

We have two bugs here and they refer to same issue, I believe.

-Bring up edit search engine dialog.
-Make any search engine as default search engine

(Issue 1: after search engine is made as default, notice 'Make default'  
button is not grayed out, i.e still clickable)
-Delete the default search engine.
-Make another search engine as default one.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Inspect Element is broken

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Navigate to google.com 2. Right click on the google image and select Inspect Element from context menu What is the expected output? Inspector should highlight the selected element's code What do you see instead? <html> Chromium 3.0.196.0 (Developer Build 21707)

title.$t: WebKit bug 28350 blocks dev-channel release

content.$t:
https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=28350 causes WebKit to render 
MediaWiki, in particular Wikipedia, incorrectly.  Even though this bug is 
caused by the script and stylesheet provided by MediaWiki itself, we need to 
fix this bug upstream before releasing a dev-channel because it affects the 
user experience on major websites.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Anchor elements cannot be clicked when an image is present in the same column of a table with inappropriate/no height defined

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to http://www.echoecho.com/javascript.htm 2. Try to click on any of the links under javascript basics, browser detection, etc What is the expected output? The user should be able to navigate to that page. What do you see instead? On mouse hover the pointer doesn't change and doesn't allow to navigate. I'm not sure how many websites are affected by this behavior. This happens with Chromium 4.0.203.0 (Developer Build 23825). Webkit nightly 47288 works fine.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Entire video doesn't play

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to http://www.cnn.com/video/ 2. Click on any of the video What is the expected output? To play the entire video What do you see instead? It just stops playing and the next video will be seen. This happens on http://abcnews.go.com/ as well

title.$t: Flash doesn't correctly overlay content (gmail, bubbleTweet)

content.$t:
- go to http://www.bubbletweet.com/showBT.php?id=e59oa
- watch flash movie that plays over content

expected:
- movie should correctly overlay content, no black square.

Actual:
- black square under plug-in and on top of page content.

title.$t: Focus is not restored after dismissing find-in bar with pre-populated search word

content.$t:
Repro on ToT (r25720)

Usecase 1:
#########
-On NNTP, make sure keyboard focus on Omnibox
-Ctrl+F to find-in bar and type 'foo'
-Esc to dismiss the find-in bar. [ focus is not restored to Omnibox - I
believe this is expected behavior]
-Now refresh the NNTP/create any number of NNTP's/delete the search word
from Find-in bar search box and create steps 2 and 3.

Expected: Keyboard focus should be restored to Omnibox. But It never.

Usecase 2:
##########
-Navigate to google home page - notice focus is on the search box.
-Ctrl+f to find-in bar and type 'foo'
-Esc to dismiss the find-in bar.

Result:
Google's search box is highlighted but the caret does not blink on the
search box.

PS: Usecase 2 is a regression.

title.$t: Sometimes websites don't load properly (css not loaded, or gmail fails to load), clearing cache fixes things for a while

content.$t: Chrome Version : Chromium 4.0.212.0 (Developer Build 26435) WebKit 532.0 V8 1.3.11.1 User Agent Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US) AppleWebKit/532.0 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/4.0.212.0 Safari/532.0 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Use Chromium normally, check Gmail often 2. At a certain point, Gmail fails loading (loads to 9x% and says that a time-out occurred), clearing cache fixes it right away 3. Sometimes loading sites like slashdot.org would present the site with a broken layout, with obviously some css files not loaded What is the expected result? Gmail loads, other sites with normal layout What happens instead? Broken layout, gmail fails to load It's really hard to reproduce this one, but just from the daily usage of Chromium I always have it, it's quite annoying and started happening around 2-3 days ago (maybe less?), maybe some changes to the way content is cached triggered this ?

title.$t: Crash regression in r29897

content.$t:
It looks like my plugin canvas change introduced a regression.

It's possible these allocations were always failing and the old code just 
tolerated it (since it wasn't using the PlatformCanvas). On the other hand, 
the exact line seems to indicate that we're using >1.5GB of memory. If this 
is true, there is likely a leak related to the bitmap management.

title.$t: Cannot check locale from within the utility process

content.$t:
Whenever I try to install an extension, the renderer NOTREACHes (sad tab). I 
tracked it down to the fact that we now check the locale when validating the 
extension. 

The functions under the hood do a GetFileAttributes on the local DLL (en-
US.dll), which we don't have access to from within the sandbox (utility 
process). Therefore we get ACCESS_DENIED and Chrome thinks no locale is 
installed and NOTREACHes() on l10n_util:482.

title.$t: Form autofill is broken

content.$t:
Build: r4.0.226.0


The form auto fill is completely broken. It is no more persisting form values.

title.$t: Empty body setInterval(..., 0) causes 100% CPU use

content.$t:
The follow test page:

<script>
setInterval(function() {}, 0);
</script>

will cause CPU use to sit at 100%, sometimes, if I leave it alone on the latest dev 
channel release on my very fast Windows 7 box.  I've verified that the clamping to 
4ms is working correct and that it's not V8's garbage collector going crazy, looks 
like something else is horribly wrong.  I haven't been able to repro on OS X, but 
given how unreliably this happens with the simple test page I don't want to say 
anything definitive about that just yet.

I think the root cause of this is also behind lots of the various 100% CPU reports 
seen on various sites (gmail, nytimes, etc) since it's very easy to leak a 
setInterval().

title.$t: regression : form autofill broken

content.$t: Chrome 4.0.226.0 (Official Build 30140) [Windows, Mac and Linux] What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to options > Clear Browsing Data 2. Select Clear Saved Form Data and time period Everything 3. Login to gmail 4. Logout What is the expected output? username should be seen in dropdown when you start typing the same What do you see instead? no form data is getting saved Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: REGRESSION: CF doesn't update to the latest version when it's previous version is in use

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install CF-223.9 from http://www.google.com/chromeframe 2. Launch IE and navigate to cf:about: 3. Now install CF-237 4. Close IE, reopen and navigate to cf:about: What is the expected output? CF version should be 237. What do you see instead? It still shows 223.9. I see both pv and opv keys lying there in the registry even after exiting IE. This is happening on Vista(IE8)

title.$t: CONTENT_SETTING_DEFAULT being returned for session/localStorage and database

content.$t:
Will try to investigate further, but I'm in the middle of looking into another 
problem and I'm reliably hitting a DCHECK on the 3rd to last line of 
dom_storage_area.cc.  It seems that CONTENT_SETTING_DEFAULT is being 
returned by 
GetContentSetting("file:///D:/src/chrome1/src/third_party/WebKit/LayoutTes
ts/storage/domstorage/sessionstorage/window-open.html", 
CONTENT_SETTINGS_TYPE_COOKIES)

You told me to file a bug if I ever saw CONTENT_SETTING_DEFAULT, so here I 
am.  Will look into it more if I get a chance.

This may be a release blocker if it affects stuff other than local storage.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Horizontal lines appear on screen after scrolling down and then up on NY Times website

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.361.0 (42338) Archlinux URLs (if applicable) : www.nytimes.com Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x:OK IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Go to www.nytimes.com 2.Scroll towards the bottom of the page 3.Scroll back up to the top What is the expected result? To see the top of the page, properly rendered without horizontal lines marring the image. What happens instead? You get horizontal lines marring the image. This looks like a Dumont TV set with a rabbit-ear antenna in 1949. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: [Extensions] Clicking on browser action in incognito mode can not open a page properly

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install Google Mail Checker extension 2. Go to chrome://extensions, check "Allow this extension to run in incognito" for Google Mail Checker 3. Open Incognito window, and click the browser action of Google Mail Checker What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The gmail page is opened in normal mode window, but it should be opened in the current incognito window since it has already been enabled in incognito mode. This issue is detected in trunk build 5.0.361.0 (Developer Build 42349) on Windows XP, it also happens in build 5.0.360.0 (r 42309) on Ubuntu9.04 Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Crash because of corrupted history in r50325

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Build chromium on the mac from r50325 2. Nuke the application support directory for Chromium (rm -rf ~/Library/Application\ Support/Chromium) 3. Startup the browser. 4. Navigate to a Livejournal account (for which you have access and have visited with another browser on the same computer) friends page 5. Allow Chromium to use the keychain. 6. Type in the user name to log in to livejournal and tab. The password should be auto-filled in. 7. Hit return to accept the password. You should be logged in to livejournal. 8. Quit chromium. 9. Restart chromium and enter a web address (e.g. www.facebook.com) into the omnibar. Chromium will usually crash on the first w. This sequence has worked for me about 4 times out of five, but it did fail once; I suspect that I may have moved too fast and quit from Chromium before the history was saved (happens about every 10 seconds from code inspection.) What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: Continuing to let me enter a web address, with auto-complete suggestions. title.$t: Chromium stops saving files at 25MB / 40MB for any large downloads

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Navigate to a dangerous file (e.g. an executable file with .exe extension) that is larger than 40MB. (Make sure the file is not harmful on your computer) 2. Select 'Save' when prompted What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Chromium saves the entire file with its original size. Please use labels and text to provide additional information. Chromium saves only the first 40mb of the file. I suspect there's a issue around file renaming.

title.$t: Chromium crash on certain Google search terms

content.$t: Chrome Version : 7.0.505.0 (Developer Build 57278) Ubuntu 10.04 URLs (if applicable) : http://www.google.com Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Firefox 3.x: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to http://www.google.com 2. Enter a search term is doesn't like (for instance "concurrent queue" without quotes) 3. Enjoy the "Aw, snap!" message What is the expected result? I get displayed search results What happens instead? "Aw, snap!" message Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: Renderer Crash @ WebCore::Editor::selectionStartCSSPropertyValue

content.$t: Chrome Version : 7.0.512.0 (Official Build 58142) URLs (if applicable) : hotmail.com Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. log into hotmail.com 2. click "New" to compose new mail ( or Reply, Reply all, Forward) 3. click on the message body textarea What is the expected result? What happens instead? When clicking on the textarea, the renderer crashes. title.$t: [Chrome OS - Extensions] Chrome crashes when disable an extension from browser action UI button context menu

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Login to chrome OS 2. Install some extensions which has browser action UI button 3. Right click on the UI button, click "Disable" What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Chrome crashes and then relaunches with information like "Google Chrome didn't shut down correctly..." I think this could be a release blocker of Chrome OS. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Tab dies after exactly 10 seconds

content.$t: Chrome Version : build 24227 OS + version : Linux 2.6.31-rc5 CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 32-bit window manager : KDE URLs (if applicable) : http://lists.samba.org/archive/samba-technical Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): Nothing Happens What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open the URL: http://lists.samba.org/archive/samba-technical/ 2. Open a new tab, and keep the focus out of the samba.org tab. 3. Count 10 seconds. What is the expected result? Nothing should happens. What happens instead? Samba.org tab dies. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot and backtrace if possible. Ten seconds countdown starts when Samba.org loses focus.

title.$t: Regression: double event on some key sequences

content.$t: Chrome Version : all newest daily builds OS + version : debian very unstable/experimental CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 64-bit window manager : compiz under gnome What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. open some url 2. ctrl-t 3. ctrl-w other way: 1. open some url with text/input box 2. enter some text 3. hit backspace other way: 1. same as prev 2. same as prev 3. ctrl+enter What is the expected result? in first example close opened tab in second - remove last character in box in last - submit form What happens instead? in first exaple 2 tabs are closed in second - one character is removed, but later browser executes "back" method (like usual backspace does with focus outside input box) in last example - in input box i can see new line added, and THEN form is submited (with additional \n unwanted character) Additional info: builds with date earlier than 29-Sep-2009 (in example 27468) are working as expected - bug (or bugs) was added in one of 29-Sep-2009 commits. i don't have time now to dissect in which one commit/line specifically it was.

title.$t: dropdown list show up as blank

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.237.0 (Official 31086) OS + version : Jaunty CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 32bit window manager : Gnome URLs (if applicable) : Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): Behavior in Chrome for Windows (optional): What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Login to gmail.com and logout (if autofill hasn't save the form) 2. Start typing into the login box to see the suggestions 3. What is the expected result? Suggestions should show up What happens instead? Suggestions are blank. White space showing Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot and backtrace if possible.

title.$t: Major regression: Gmail freezes completely

content.$t:
Chrome Version       : 4.0.237.0
OS + version : hardy
CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 64
window manager : Gnome
URLs (if applicable) : mail.google.com/a/google.com
Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): works
Behavior in Chrome for Windows (optional): works

From time to time (several times per day) the tab with Gmail completely 
freezes, not responding to mouse, keyboard, scrolls or anything. Other tabs 
work.

F5 in this tab reloads Gmail, but after reload Gmail stays non-responsible.

If I open a new window with Ctrl+N, and opening Gmail in it, new Gmail is 
working perfectly. But after some time (minutes or hours) it also freezes.

It just appeared in the recent dev release. It seems to be limited to 
Google Apps gmail, not personal gmail.

title.$t: Can't dump symbols from official builds when Chrome is linked with --gc-section

content.$t:
r32330 cut the Chrome binary size down by quite a bit, but now dump_syms
can no longer get the STABS symbols out of it.

If r32330 is getting merged into 249, then this is a release blocker.

Visit http://www.volkskrant.nl/opmerkelijk/article1330479.ece/Agent_trekt_pistool _bij_sneeuwballengevecht 2. Scroll down 3. What do you expect to happen? I expect that the window doesn't resize. content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.289.0 (Developer Build 35448) Ubuntu URLs (if applicable) : What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Right Click on selected text or in an text box. They are still functional such as searching Google or fixing spelling mistakes when clicked. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: REGRESSION: sad tab on http://www.hadess.net (and others, include google maps)

content.$t:
Page seems to render, then crash.

Regression range:
http://build.chromium.org/buildbot/perf/dashboard/ui/changelog.html?
url=/trunk/src&range=36263:36342

The backtrace makes no sense -- all the addresses are in the stack, not in 
the code.  This makes me suspect the v8 roll ager did.

Linux 64.

title.$t: Forecastfox causes segmentation fault on 5.0.318.0 (Developer Build 38172) Ubuntu

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.318.0 (Developer Build 38172) Ubuntu Is this the most recent version: yes OS + version: Ubuntu 9.10 64-bit CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 64-bit Window manager: ubuntu default Behavior in Windows Chrome (if you have access to it): don't have access to it, but a user reported a similar problem. 1. Install Forecastfox from the extension gallery: https://chrome.google.com/extensions/detail/ihffmkcfkejomlfnilnmkokcpgclhfeg 2. Chrome immediately segmentation faults. I tried to get a backtrace, but my desktop doesn't respond to the keyboard or mouse after I reproduce the segmentation fault with GDB attached. The only way to make it responsive is to switch to a shell and kill the gdb and chromium-browser processes. Any tips? I've attached what it recorded up until where I had to kill gdb.

title.$t: Crash v8::internal::Heap::PerformGarbageCollection

content.$t:
Platform:
  Hostname: krisr-macbookpro.local
  Mac OS X Version 10.5.7 (Build 9J61)
  Processor: 2 Intel 2.40 GHz
  RAM: 2048 MB

Chrome:
  Chrome version: 4.0.203.1  <<<Release/Debug>>>
  QuickTime Player: 7.6.2
  Flash Player: 10.0.22.87

Steps to reproduce:
  No steps, it looks like I got into a state where I was crashing and had 
Google Chrome Helpers running on their own (about 4 each using 50% of

title.$t: Autocomplete box segfaults renderer

content.$t: Chrome Version : tot (r26906) OS + version : ubuntu karmic CPU architecture : x64 chrome What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. type in 'hello' to a text entry box eg http://scholar.google.com and press enter 2. go back to http://scholar.google.com and type in 'hell'. The autocomplete box should appear 3. press any other key so the autocomplete box has no matches, eg press space 4. Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault. 0x0000000000b18727 in WebViewImpl::HideAutoCompletePopup() () The backtrace is full of calls to HideAutoCompletePopup(), eg: #135812 0x0000000000b1872c in WebViewImpl::HideAutoCompletePopup() () #135813 0x0000000000b1872c in WebViewImpl::HideAutoCompletePopup() () #135814 0x0000000000b1872c in WebViewImpl::HideAutoCompletePopup() () so I didn't include it here.

title.$t: Our thing is broken on Snow Leopard

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expect: application Observe: crash Please use labels and text to provide additional information. Cause: r30647, bug 25857, http://codereview.chromium.org/343024 -- Not really working... We're pretty much entirely broken on Snow Leopard now. First, I found that +[MessagePumpNSAppDeferredAutoreleasePool alloc] was returning objects of type NSAutoreleasePool, as evidenced by: 2009-10-30 21:28:03.204 base_unittests[27990:903] - [NSAutoreleasePool initWithPump:]: unrecognized selector sent to instance 0x1231b80 So I stuck this into DeferredAutoreleasePool: + (id)allocWithZone:(NSZone*)zone { return NSAllocateObject(self, 0, zone); } and promptly started crashing thusly: Program received signal EXC_BAD_ACCESS, Could not access memory. Reason: KERN_PROTECTION_FAILURE at address: 0x0000009e 0x0018a88d in base::MessagePumpNSApplication::set_needs_event_loop_wake_up_true (this=0x45) at message_pump_mac.h:257 257 needs_event_loop_wake_up_ = true; (gdb) bt #0 0x0018a88d in base::MessagePumpNSApplication::set_needs_event_loop_wake_up_true (this=0x45) at message_pump_mac.h:257 #1 0x001882e1 in base::SetNeedsEventLoopWakeUpTrue (pump=0x45) at /chrome/trunk/src/base/message_pump_mac.mm:841 #2 0x001883f5 in -[MessagePumpNSAppDeferredAutoreleasePool drain] (self=0x140d910, _cmd=0x90f9a8d4) at /chrome/trunk/src/base/message_pump_mac.mm:921 #3 0x9078075b in -[NSApplication run] () #4 0x00188a82 in base::MessagePumpNSApplication::DoRun (this=0x1229410, delegate=0xbffff4d4) at /chrome/trunk/src/base/message_pump_mac.mm:685 0x45 is the special value I set pump_ to in -[MessagePumpNSAppDeferredAutoreleasePool drain] to verify what was going on. And hey, how did NSApplication get a hold of a MessagePumpNSAppDeferredAutoreleasePool? NSAutoreleasePool on Snow Leopard is maintaining its own cache of NSAutoreleasePool objects, and is doling them out via +alloc. This is so frustrating. I tried this yesterday on Snow Leopard specifically to see if it would recycle pools, and it didn't seem to.

In addition, I think there might be a correlation between this is the

as result of authentication, but I'm uncertain about that.

Any ideas or fixes?

title.$t: official build startup gets profile directory wrong for some checks

content.$t:
I found this with a debug build, not sure how much is getting things wrong, but the DChecks helped trip it up.

1. Install and configure chrome, enable stats checking
2. Launch debug offical build, with --user-data-dir pointing some places else

You'll die in the first launch code because of a dcheck about breakpad being already initialized.

What's happening is:

chrome_dll_main.cc::ChromeMain() (line 536) calls InitCrashReporter()
InitCrashReporter() does this:
  bool enable_breakpad =
      is_browser ? GoogleUpdateSettings::GetCollectStatsConsent() :
                   command_line->HasSwitch(switches::kEnableCrashReporter);

So we go into GoogleUpdateSettings::GetCollectStatsConsent().

google_update_settings_posix.cc has GoogleUpdateSettings::GetCollectStatsConsent().  That checks the "Consent To Send 
Stats" file, but PathService::Get(chrome::DIR_USER_DATA, &consent_file) call is giving back ~/Library/Application 
Support/Google/Chrome/.  

This happens because chrome_dll_main.cc line 614 seems to be where we actually check for the command line argument.
